name: stick
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thin piece of wood or other material

example.eg: The old man was carrying a load of sticks.
example.egtrans: 那个老人抱着一捆树枝。

example.eg: Police said that the child had been beaten with a stick.
example.egtrans: 警方说那个孩子被人用木棍打了。

example.eg: Find some dry sticks and we'll make a campfire.
example.egtrans: 找些干树枝，我们来点堆篝火。

example.eg: A lollipop is a sweet on a stick.
example.egtrans: 棒棒糖是一团裹在小棍上的糖。

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin wooden pole that especially old or injured people use to help them walk
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指长者或伤者用的）手杖，拐杖

example.eg: a walking stick
example.egtrans: 拐杖

example.eg: At 84 he's still quite active, although he walks with the aid of a stick.
example.egtrans: 他84岁了，虽然走路需要拄着拐杖，可仍旧非常硬朗。

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin piece of wood used in playing various sports
trans_examp.trans_cn: （曲棍球或兜网球）球棍；（马球）球杆

example.eg: a hockey/lacrosse/polo stick
example.egtrans: 曲棍球球棍／兜网球球棍／马球球杆

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin piece of something

example.eg: carrot/bread sticks
example.egtrans: 胡萝卜条／面包棍

example.eg: a stick of celery/rhubarb/chewing gum/chalk/dynamite
example.egtrans: 一根芹菜／一棵大黄／一片口香糖／一根粉笔／一根雷管

trans_examp.trans_en: a car with a stick shift

example.eg: Do you drive a stick?
example.egtrans: 你开手动车吗？

example.eg: When they got married, they didn't have a stick of furniture.
example.egtrans: 他们结婚时，一件家具都没有。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to hit someone or something with a long, thin piece of wood

example.eg: He said that when he was a boy, his father used to take a stick to him to punish him.
example.egtrans: 他说他小的时候，他爸爸经常用棍子惩罚他。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: I really got/took stick from my boss about being late for work again.
example.egtrans: 我因为上班又迟到了，被老板狠狠数落了一通。

example.eg: We gave him some stick for wearing that silly hat.
example.egtrans: 他戴着那顶愚蠢透顶的帽子，被我们批评了一通。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an area in the countryside that is far from a town or city

example.eg: I'm sick of living in the sticks.
example.egtrans: 我受够了偏僻乡村的生活。

example.eg: They live out in the sticks somewhere.
example.egtrans: 他们住在某个偏远的地方。

name: stick
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause something to become fixed, for example with glue or another similar substance

example.eg: I tried to stick the pieces together with some glue/tape.
example.egtrans: 我想用胶水／胶带把这些部件粘到一起。

example.eg: He stuck up an announcement on the board with pins.
example.egtrans: 他用大头针把告示钉在布告板上。

example.eg: This glue won't stick.
example.egtrans: 这种胶水粘不牢。

example.eg: My car's stuck in the mud.
example.egtrans: 我的车陷在泥里了。

example.eg: Stir the sauce so that it doesn't stick to the pan.
example.egtrans: 不断搅拌酱汁，以免粘锅。

example.eg: My book got wet and all the pages have stuck together.
example.egtrans: 我的书湿了，书页都粘在一起了。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a name sticks, it continues to be used.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （名字）继续使用的，保持不变的

example.eg: Although her name is Clare, her little sister called her Lali, and somehow the name stuck.
example.egtrans: 虽然她的名字是克莱尔，她的妹妹却叫她拉莉，不知怎么的，这个名字就叫开了。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put something somewhere, especially in a not very careful way

example.eg: "Where shall I put these books?" "Oh, just stick them on the table for now."
example.egtrans: “我该把这些书放在哪儿？＂“噢，就先放在桌子上吧。＂

example.eg: She stuck her fingers in her ears so that she couldn't hear the noise.
example.egtrans: 她用手指塞住耳朵，这样就听不到那些噪音了。

example.eg: I'll pay for lunch - I can stick it on my expenses.
example.egtrans: 午餐我来请客——我可以把它算入报销费用。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you tell someone to stick something or where they can stick something, it means that you do not want to keep that thing.

example.eg: "I've had enough of working here," she said, "You can stick your job!"
example.egtrans: “我这儿要干的事已经够多了，＂她说，“你的活儿自己留着吧！＂

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to push a pointed object into or through something, or (of a pointed object) to be pushed into or through something and stay there

example.eg: She stuck the needle into my arm.
example.egtrans: 她把针头扎进我的胳膊。

example.eg: We decided where to go for our holiday by closing our eyes and sticking a pin in the map.
example.egtrans: 我们闭上眼睛，用大头针往地图上插，这样决定了去哪里度假。

example.eg: A thorn stuck in her finger.
example.egtrans: 她的手指扎了一根刺。

example.eg: The metal springs were sticking through the mattress.
example.egtrans: 金属弹簧穿透垫子露了出来。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: In some card games, if you stick, you say that you do not want to be given any more cards.

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to bear or accept something or someone unpleasant

example.eg: I don't think I can stick this job a day longer.
example.egtrans: 我认为这份工作我一天也忍受不下去了。

example.eg: I don't know how you can stick living in this place.
example.egtrans: 我不知道你住在这样的地方怎么能受得了。
